title: IVR-Based Language Learning Simulation: Immersive Science-Themed Language Acquisition Project Through Group Inquiry

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language proficiency (grammar/vocabulary/pronunciation), experience using digital devices, and understanding of basic scientific topics (pandemics, vaccines, etc.)
context.additional_context: Individual BYOD (smart devices or VR headsets) utilization with group collaboration spaces. Provision of scientific glossaries and translation tools for language skill reinforcement; instructors evaluate learner-produced outputs (speech/text) as portfolios.

learning_goals: Learners accurately comprehend and listen to target-language scientific texts/audio materials (e.g., pandemic response) at 80% or higher accuracy through group inquiry in an IVR environment and structurally explain key content.

Learners perform three or more role-plays/debates with peers using target-language communication strategies (questions, requests, persuasive expressions) in a VR simulation, utilizing collaboration tools (screen sharing, voice chat).

Learners systematically document and present case studies of vocabulary and grammar usage related to scientific topics, practical outcomes, and self-reflection (analysis of communication barriers) in language portfolios created based on IVR learning experiences.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
